data.title: Hugo Gernsback
authors: Contributors to The H.P. Lovecraft Wiki
data.meta_description: Hugo Gernsback (born Hugo Gernsbacher, 16 August 1884 – 19 August 1967) was a prolific editor and magazine publisher. Born in Luxembourg City, Luxembourg, he later emigrated to the United States where he became a naturalised citizen and established his name in the burgeoning publishing industry...
data.text:
Hugo Gernsback (born Hugo Gernsbacher, 16 August 1884 – 19 August 1967) was a prolific editor and magazine publisher. Born in Luxembourg City, Luxembourg, he later emigrated to the United States where he became a naturalised citizen and established his name in the burgeoning publishing industry.

Gernsback was referred to as "Hugo the Rat" by both H. P. Lovecraft and Clark Ashton Smith as a result of his tendency to pay authors both poorly and late for their submissions.

In Fiction[]

In "The Battle that Ended the Century", the character Ivor K. Rodent was a private jab at Gernsback.

"In the Walls of Eryx" contains a species of creature dubbed Ugrats, a reference to his nickname of Hugo the Rat.

[]
